title: Ruibo Sun’s Website
text:
Skills

Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Word, Excel) and G Suite Programs (Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides)
Basic Knowledge of R, Python, SQL
Self-motivated and excellent communication skills with diverse stakeholders



Education

Financial Economics Specialist and Specialist in Statistical Science (Methods and Practice) University of Toronto - St. George Campus
Art and Science Internship Program (Co-op Program)
Course Work: Intermediate level of Microeconomics and Macroeconomics, Probability and Statistics, Theory of Statistical Practice, Observation data and Sampling, Linear Regression and Statistical Methods for Machine Learning
GPA: 3.87/4.0
Awards: Dean’s List for 2021 Summer and 2022 Winter, Jackman Scholars-in-Residence Scholarship 2022 and Mary Keenan Award 2022



Experience
Statistical Science Department, University of Toronto – Statistical Consultant

Searched ahead on speakers’ research interests and prepared for statistical insights/suggestions that are closely related to their specific research topics.
Communicated effectively with speakers from diverse fields/backgrounds in verbal and non-verbal communication.

Economics Department, University of Toronto – Research Assistant

Used Excel to perform regular data entry tasks and data manipulation independently on annual reports from 1978 to 2020 for the US Railroads and merged data into one file.
Used R to clean and visualize the critical data/variables across time for further analysis.
